content.description: short. but a fun problem. start standing on the skirt with a high, good sloper  and left hand pocket. Pull up and get a large, sloping horn with a lip. posture up and fight for the big sloper topout.
content.location: First climb on Little New Wall. Not the most obvious line since there are other unestablished easier lines on either side. look for the triangular horn sticking out.

content.description: Start in the left-hand pocket/right-hand crimp/pocket down and left of the big undercling. Move into the undercling and finish Fire in the Belly.
content.location: Start holds are directly left and below the undercling of FITB.

content.description: Big moves up a slightly overhung face with an interesting throw. End with the obvious match or do the dirty top out.
content.location: Near the center of the wall. Climbs through the gray stair step roof.

content.description: This route is on the right side of little new wall and starts in a "window" (when you see it you'll get it). Move straight up through the various large pockets to the ferns on top. Decent route, great for a warm up, toping out may be the hardest part of this line.
content.location: The far right side of little new wall, look for the large square "window" in at chest level.

content.description: Soft for the grade... for the area. SDS- This problem starts under a bulge with a jug. Right to a solid mono and then up to a ledge. The concensus is to drop off the jug a few feet above the ledge. But the topout is fine/dirty.
content.location: Just passed Que Lindo. Look for the obvious mono low on the wall

content.description: start in a large hueco with your feet on the skirt. Move across a good pocket and crimp to a large hueco undercling(an interesting feature). Get ready to leave the skirt up to a shallow pocket and 2 bomb proof pockets. Follow ledges to the top.
content.location: just before a large boulder and small tree along Little New Wall

content.description: Start low on the orange stained rock in the middle of the wall. Work your way up a cracked block, into 2 good pockets before getting into the seem of small pockets (crux) in the black rock. skipping smaller pockets is in order for tall people. Rock quality is not bad at all but the first couple of moves on the cracked block are sharp as all get out.
content.location: middle(ish) of little new wall to the right of que lindo. starts in the orange stained rock with good holds.

content.description: start on the same "window" as nada (V0) but move left and up through the vertical cracks with decent quality rock. This route ends at the cracked block.
content.location: the farthest right side of little new wall. starts at the large square "window" at chest level (when you see it you'll understand).

content.description: A Rogers classic. Start in the same hueco as Fire in the Belly. Go up to a flake, set up and make a strong move to good crimps on the face. continue up the shallow dihedral(type feature) or make a committing move to the lip.
content.protection: Crashpads and spotters. The more the better as the landing is fairly heinous. Be especially tentative on the throw for the top.
content.location: Just past Fire in the Belly. This climb is right above a low boulder and next to a small tree.

content.description: A tall wall with ferns and many blocky features.
